values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

Looks reasonable. I don't have time to dig in to the differences with the original proposal, but this looks like it should address the need.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is a good start but definitely lacking multiple things;

1. Existing tests needs to be fixed (1 test can be removed as code related to that test has been removed, but other tests needs to be fixed)

2. New unit and functional tests needs to be added

3. We need a job which will deploy 2 glance api service and provide tempest test to verify that proxying is actually happening.

4. Also this patch has a regression; If image conversion plugin is enabled then it is not clearing temporary .raw file from staging area.

5. Behavior change: Virtual size is set at staging which was not the case before this change

6. Location entry is shown in the output for staging data (we can not avoid this as it will break entire locations API) - So again there is a question of fundamental approach here

7. Location also shows multihash, hashing_algo as a part of location metadata

8. After image is imported to store, each location shows staging as False in locations entry which is not desired

9. weird behavior with --allow-failure false
   Deleted some file stores manually and then ran image-create-via import with --all-stores True and  --allow-failure False
   Image remains in importing state (which is correct)
   Image is deleted from staging store (disk, which is correct)
   It shows staging entry in image locations output
   Also image_locations database has active entry for staging  

10 Same is the case with --stores and --allow-failure false

I think this needs in detail manual testing to check regression and all possible combinations of image import with all command line options, plugins enabled/disabled, single store/multi store, and also along with location APIs.
